title: Has a man ever been the King of England? - Quora

response.answer_text: What kind of question is this? Is it a joke or what? If England has always been a kingdom, how could it not have had a king? Does this guy think England was some sort of matriarchal tyranny, or perhaps a cryptocracy? Nine of each ten rulers of England have been men, just as everywhere else in the world. I don’t see the point of this question so I am simply unable to give a direct answer rather than a lecture. Maybe he believes Queen Elizabeth is one-thousand years old?

Where to start? 1 - Only men become kings and women become queens (with the exception of RuPaul and Lilly Savage, who are not THAT sort of queen). 2 - The last King of England was Henry III, The last King of England & Wales was Henry VII, the last King of England, Wales & Ireland was Henry VIII, the last King of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland was George V and the last King of the United Kingdom of Great Britain & Northern Ireland was George VI. 3 - Between the reign of Egbert (827 - 839) and Henry III (1216 - 1272) which was the start of a unified English Crown and the takeover of Wales, all the monarchs were Kingy Thingies who had wives with the title Queen, but were only Queenies through their hubbies’ jobs. `4 - If you have any trouble understanding this, I will refer you to my soon to be published book ‘How To Spot the Difference Between Kings & Queens for Dummies’ available in all good bookshops and some pretty disreputable ones too.

Said tongue in cheek “ no, no man ever has been the king of England ! “ sorry just had to answer that in the best way I know how !!! I suggest you get some British history books they answer all inane questions such as this one . Happy reading and discovering :))
Henry the viii is one of the most famous monarchs in history. He ruled England in the 16th century. That’s one of many. The majority of England’s monarchs have been male :)
No man or that matter woman has ever been King of England. Since 973 AD the position has been filled by fluffy kitten, as they are good for tourism.
Yes, every single King of England has always been a Man, and probably always will be. Q: Has a man ever been the King of England?
Let's see - George 1-3, Henry 1-8 etc. How am I doing?
Only a man can be a king.
